DOC.brief_summary: We propose a study to determine the single-dose pharmacokinetics of these two novel formulations of testosterone in normal men with experimentally induced hypogonadism.
DOC.brief_title: ORAL T-6: Oral Androgens in Man-6
DOC.detailed_description: This is an 2-3 month open-label, two week pharmacokinetic study of two novel formulations of oral testosterone (T), in normal men whose endogenous T production has been temporarily suppressed by the administration of the potent GnRH antagonist Acyline. We will be determining the relative pharmacokinetics of six different oral formulations of T in both rapid and slow release compared to the immediate release preparation studied previously by our group.
DOC.criteria: males between 18 to 50 years of age in good general health based on normal screening evaluation must agree not to participate in another research drug study during participation must agree to not donate blood during the study must be willing to comply with the study protocol and procedures must agree to use an acceptable form of contraception agrees to not take medications other than the study drugs for the duration of the study Subject in poor health, determined by medical history physical and lab results a known history or current use of alcohol, drug or steroid abuse and/or use of more than 3 alcohol beverages per day Participation in a longterm contraceptive study within the past two months History of bleeding disorders or current use of anticoagulants History of sleep apnea and/or major psychiatric disorders
